author: Special Correspondent
text:
Members of the People's Welfare Front staging a protest demanding action against those who harassed Alag, a farmer, in Ariyalur on Tuesday.

About 87 members of constituent parties of the People’s Welfare Front were taken into custody at Ariyalur after they resorted to a road blockade demanding action those responsible for pushing the small farmer, Alagar, to commit suicide.

Alagar committed suicide by consuming pesticide after his tractor was seized for loan default by employees of a private finance firm.

On Tuesday, the protesters led by K. Balakrishnan, State president, Tamil Nadu Vivasayigal Sangam, and local leaders MDMK, CPI, and Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi, blocked the traffic near the Anna Statue in the town to press for the demand. The police said all the arrested were later released in the evening.
title: PWF activists court arrest
